greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 1 if n is an odd prime otherwise a(n) = n.
comment: Tested to coincide with A005451 in the index range n=3..20000. [From _R. J. Mathar_, Sep 11 2008]
mathematica: (* Composite Product*) p[n_]=n!/Product[Prime[i], {i, 2, PrimePi[n]}] digits=200 a0=Table[p[n]/p[n-1], {n, 2, digits}] (* Composites by sorting out ones and two*) Delete[Delete[Union[a0], 1], 1]
results.author: _Roger L. Bagula_, Nov 04 2003
